title: Level 3 Measurement Practice Test
description: Test your skills with formal units, telling time, elapsed time and perimeter!

questions.question: How many centimetres are in 3 metres?
Which unit would be best to measure the mass of a watermelon?
questions.explanation: A watermelon is heavy (about 3-5 kg), so **kilograms** is the best unit. Grams would give a very big number (3000-5000 g). Centimetres and litres measure length and capacity, not mass.

questions.question: The hour hand has just passed 3 and the minute hand points to the 9. What time is it?
questions.explanation: The hour hand past 3 means the hour is 3. The minute hand on 9 means $9 \times 5 = 45$ minutes. The time is **3:45** (quarter to 4).

questions.question: A TV show starts at 5:40 PM and ends at 6:25 PM. How long is the show?
questions.explanation: From 5:40 to 6:00 = 20 minutes. From 6:00 to 6:25 = 25 minutes. Total: $20 + 25 = 45$ minutes.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of a rectangle with length 12 cm and width 5 cm?
A square playground has sides of 15 m. What is the perimeter?
questions.explanation: A square has 4 equal sides. $P = 4 \times 15 = 60 \text{ m}$.

questions.question: How many grams are in 2 kilograms?
School starts at 8:50 AM and lunch is at 12:30 PM. How many minutes is that?
questions.explanation: From 8:50 to 9:00 = 10 min. From 9:00 to 12:00 = 3 hours = 180 min. From 12:00 to 12:30 = 30 min. Total: $10 + 180 + 30 = 220$ minutes (or 3 hours and 40 minutes).

questions.question: A triangle has sides of 7 cm, 8 cm and 10 cm. What is its perimeter?
A rectangle has a perimeter of 30 cm. The length is 10 cm. What is the width?
questions.explanation: $P = 2 \times (l + w)$. So $30 = 2 \times (10 + w)$. Divide by 2: $15 = 10 + w$. Subtract 10: $w = 5 \text{ cm}$.
